quote: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—I took the one less traveled by.
author: Robert Frost
context: A poem about choices and their consequences.

quote: Ask not what your country can do for you—ask what you can do for your country.
author: John F. Kennedy
context: A call to civic action and public service.

quote: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein
context: Encouragement to find the positive in challenges.

quote: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon
context: Lyrics from a song written for his son Sean.

quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
author: Jane Austen
context: The famous opening line of the novel.

quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
context: Addressing the nation during the Great Depression.

quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Do not go gentle into that good night. Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
author: Dylan Thomas
source: Do not go gentle into that good night

quote: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill
context: Often attributed to Churchill regarding perseverance.

quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky
context: A famous quote about taking risks.

quote: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison
context: Regarding his invention of the lightbulb.

quote: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: What doesn't kill us makes us stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke
context: A call to action against injustice.

quote: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
author: George Santayana

quote: Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn.
author: Clark Gable

quote: Go ahead, make my day.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: I'm going to make him an offer he can't refuse.
author: Marlon Brando

quote: You can't handle the truth!
author: Jack Nicholson

quote: I'll have what she's having.
author: Estelle Reiner
context: Reaction to a fake orgasm in a diner.

quote: You're gonna need a bigger boat.
author: Roy Scheider
context: Upon seeing the shark for the first time.

quote: There's no place like home.
author: Judy Garland
context: Dorothy's mantra to return to Kansas.

quote: I feel the need—the need for speed!
author: Tom Cruise

quote: Houston, we have a problem.

quote: They may take our lives, but they'll never take our freedom!

quote: What we've got here is failure to communicate.
author: Strother Martin

quote: Love means never having to say you're sorry.

quote: The stuff that dreams are made of.

quote: E.T. phone home.

quote: Made it, Ma! Top of the world!

quote: I'm as mad as hell, and I'm not going to take this anymore!
author: Peter Finch

quote: Louis, I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
author: Humphrey Bogart

quote: A census taker once tried to test me. I ate his liver with some fava beans and a nice Chianti.
